content.raw: Oops -- I see the ContactForce object doesn't contain a normal, and I'm not sure it can because it is in general an aggregate of a bunch of separately-oriented force elements that constitute the ContactPatch (like for elastic foundation contact). Probably it ought to contain some kind of aggregate, force-weighted normal analogous to the center-of-pressure point it already contains. I suppose in most cases the force vector that it already contains will be aligned more-or-less with the patch normal, unless there is a lot of friction in which case it will be tipped. Is that good enough? If not, this might be a case where you have to ask for the ContactPatch details. For point contact there would only be one detail element, but for EF there could be a ton of crap there that you probably don't want.
